questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Italy is known for its impressive destruction by the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in AD 79?
questions.context: Its ruins provide an extraordinary glimpse into the daily life of a city frozen in time and buried under volcanic ash for centuries.

questions.question: What remarkable feat of modern architecture, designed by Santiago Calatrava and completed in 1998, features the highest bridge in Portugal?
questions.context: This cable-stayed bridge spans the Tagus River and was inaugurated in time for Expo 98, commemorating the 500th anniversary of Vasco da Gama's discovery of the sea route to India.

questions.question: Which historical battle site in Belgium marked the final defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte in 1815?
questions.context: The ensuing battle led to the dissolution of the Napoleonic Empire and shaped the future of Europe.

questions.question: What famous museum in St. Petersburg, Russia, founded by Catherine the Great, contains over 3 million items, including the largest collection of paintings in the world?
questions.context: The museum is housed in multiple magnificent buildings, including the iconic Winter Palace.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin located in Greece, believed to be the birthplace of the Olympic Games, includes temples dedicated to Zeus and Hera?
questions.context: This site hosted the ancient Olympics, initiated in 776 BC, that inspired the modern iteration of the Games.
